verbs.description: unbefit (third-person singular simple present unbefits, present participle unbefitting, simple past and past participle unbefitted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic, rare) Not to befit or suit; to be inappropriate for.
examples: I cannot think upon thee with the esteem  Thy talents should have won thee; and the page,  Which for a fallen enemy could teem  With scorn; or with the dead its warfare wage;  Would shame the bard, not thee, and unbefit the age.

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic, rare) To make unfit or unsuitable.
examples: No stain tarnishes the trappings to unbefit them for the adornment and control of the well groomed animal that restlessly confesses to his new experience.
